message: When the next Congress convenes this week, Republicans will set to work making President-Elect Trump's campaign promises a reality and getting Washington back on the side of the American people. Education reform and rolling back burdensome federal regulations will also be priorities.

As we enter the next Congress, I’m confident 2017 will be a year of action. We have an opportunity, and an obligation, to take bold action and get results for the American people.   This starts with delivering on the promises made to Americans during election season, including repealing Obamacare, rolling back years of crushing federal regulation and getting tough on national security.

I will speak on the House floor shortly to express strong disapproval of the recent anti-Israel action by the UN Security Council. You can watch my remarks live here. Later today, the House will take a vote on a resolution that formally objects to this betrayal of our ally.

Senator Dan Coats is a fantastic choice to lead the intelligence community and assist President-elect Donald Trump as Director of National Intelligence. Senator Coats has extraordinary judgment, a level head and is an expert in the field. Throughout his career, he has always put his country first, and I have no doubt he will bring that approach to this new job.

I will vote tonight to send a strong signal to the world that the American people reject the one-sided, short-sighted UN Security Council resolution, and that the American people stand united with Israel.
Americans are being crushed by endless and often unnecessary federal regulation. It's time to change that.

ICYMI --> On Friday, the House passed an amendment I authored to require every federal agency issuing a new rule to repeal or amend at least one existing rule, to offset costs on the U.S. economy.   In 2016 alone, federal agencies issued 18 rules and regulations for every one law passed by Congress. That’s a grand total of 3,853 regulations.   The collective weight of federal regulations puts a giant tax on the American people, and enough is enough.
Today is #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay. We're shining a #ProjectBlueLight to recognize the men and women in uniform who work hard and put their lives on the line every day to keep us safe.

Throughout our mostly rural district, with far more Christian churches than synagogues, Hoosiers are united in their support for the Jewish state.   President Obama’s silence and defection from one of our most important allies was unconscionable.
WTHR-TV reports on legislation I'm authoring to close a loophole that currently allows billions of dollars to be paid out in tax benefits to illegal immigrants.

Each year, our broken tax code is allowing billions of dollars to be paid out to illegal immigrants.  Closing this loophole will steer us back to rule of law, ensure tax benefits like this are reserved for American citizens and save us billions of dollars.
Obamacare failed. It's time to repeal and replace.
Team huddle before the 4th grade basketball game on Saturday morning. The "Mighty Five" are 2-1.
Great to be at the Indiana Statehouse yesterday, fun to see so many old friends & excited by the leadership of our new Governor!
Today I had the opportunity to join @hooverinstitution and @educationgadfly to talk about ways to ensure every kid in America has access to a quality education. #SchoolChoice
Students from my hometown high school stop by for a visit. So glad they have the opportunity to be in DC for the #Inauguration!
Students from Greensburg Community Schools are visiting our nation's capital for the 58th Presidential #Inauguration. Exciting times!
NA

This is a day for the history books. I couldn’t be more excited to see President Donald J. Trump and my good friend and fellow Hoosier Vice President Mike Pence sworn into office today.   With this new leadership, we can get Washington working again for all Americans. Hoosiers can be particularly excited that they will have a strong voice in the White House as Vice President Pence takes on this new role. I trust we will see an era of bold action and results for our country.  https://messer.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-messer-inauguration-ushers-in-era-of-bold-action-results-for-our
What an exciting day for our country and all Americans, but especially for us Hoosiers! #InaugurationDay
This is a day for the history books! Humbled and honored to be a part of #Inauguration2017
Messer girls celebrate #Inauguration2017
Fun times with the family at the Freedom Inaugural Ball last night. #Inauguration2017
Today President Trump showed he is ready and eager to keep his border security promises to the American people. We will return to rule of law and build a wall on our southern border.

Since Donald Trump’s election, some Americans have made every effort to delegitimize our new president. These misguided attempts undermine our republic and our electoral process, and fuel divisiveness in our politics. If this trend continues, the damage to our nation could long outlast any damage done to its current leader.  So let’s set the record straight. Read more of my latest column here:
Meeting with President Trump and Vice President Mike Pence. Our new leaders have hit the ground running and are already delivering for the American people.

This week is National #SchoolChoice Week. We held a rally on Capitol Hill with hundreds of students, parents and lawmakers to celebrate education opportunity. What an inspiring group of kids!   We cannot rest until every kid in America has access to a quality education. You can read more about the rally and School Choice Week here https://messer.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-messer-sen-scott-lead-school-choice-rally
Great crowd today at #marchforlife in DC! #whywemarch
Vice President Pence arrives at #marchforlife. #whywemarch
Today I joined hundreds of thousands of people from all across our country to defend life. Great to see so many Americans united for one cause. #WhyWeMarch

Your Hoosier representatives in Congress are working together to repeal Obamacare and rebuild our health care system.   Check out a recent Op Ed we wrote in the IndyStar outlining these plans.  http://www.indystar.com/story/opinion/2017/01/30/gop-looks-better-health-care-plan/97249496/  "Increased out-of-pocket costs, limited choices and restricted access are not the changes Americans were promised when Obamacare was signed into law in 2010... We are committed to working with all of our colleagues and the Trump-Pence Administration to build a health care system that works better for YOU."

This week I filed legislation to overturn a midnight regulation pushed through in the waning months of Obama's presidency that would force states to fund abortion providers.   Congress now has the opportunity to reverse this rule, restore states' rights and defend those who do not want public tax dollars to support the abortion industry.   At least 133 House members have joined me in co-sponsoring this bill, and several advocacy groups expressed their support including Indiana Right to Life.

Judge Gorsuch is a distinguished jurist and an excellent pick by President Trump to succeed Justice Scalia.  Judge Gorsuch is clearly qualified for the job, and his nomination will help ensure we have a court that upholds our Constitution, acts with judicial restraint, and defends the individual liberties of every American. He should be quickly confirmed.
Iran's recent missile tests are yet another example of how Obama's bad deal emboldened the regime. I'm glad POTUS is taking charge.

Judge Gorsuch is an excellent Supreme Court pick by the President. He is immensely qualified, respected on both sides of the aisle, and a true defender of our Constitution.   He is the peoples' choice and should be confirmed swiftly, based on merits alone.
Fox News talks about legislation I'm authoring to close a loophole allowing billions of dollars in tax credits to be paid out to illegal immigrants.

Most Americans are astonished to learn that each year billions of taxpayer dollars are given out to people who are in our country illegally.  Today, I wrote a letter to President Donald J. Trump urging him to take executive action on this issue, alongside my legislative efforts.   Let's work together to end this loophole and protect American taxpayers.  https://messer.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-messer-urges-president-trump-to-take-executive-action-on-tax

Up to $7.1 billion taxpayer dollars are paid out each year to illegal immigrants and individuals illegally claiming children through the Additional Child Tax Credit.   This program is wrought with fraud, and U.S. taxpayers are footing the bill. Donald J. Trump, let's work together to clean this up!
Catching up with Indiana's Treasurer @tos_mitchell during her visit to the Capitol. Loved hearing about her team's great work to help Hoosiers save for college.
Happy Valentine's Day to my wife Jennifer. We met on a blind date more than 17 yrs ago and the rest is history!
Hoosier manufacturing is on the rise. Exciting news in Greensburg today!

It is great to see that Israel once again has a champion in the White House. Israel is our most important friend in the region, and among America’s best partners in the world.   I’m glad President Trump is protecting this important relationship and strongly affirming that the American people stand with Israel.

BREAKING - The House just passed an effort I've focused on to overturn an Obama rule that forces states to fund abortion providers.   I will continue to fight for states' rights and policies to protect life.
States should not be coerced into funding the abortion industry by federal bureaucrats. Watch my remarks on the House floor today.

I'm excited to work with Congressman Rick Larsen on bipartisan legislation that would allow veterans to use Post 911 GI Bill benefits to cover the cost of college application fees.   Our goal is to give veterans as much flexibility and as many options as possible to help them transition from serving our country to earning a degree. This is one small way to do that.

In Congress, we're working on several ways to encourage and help Hoosiers save for retirement.   One of the ways is by making it easier for people to keep track of retirement accounts as they transition from job to job. I spoke to CBS4 Indy about this effort.
Great to be in Muncie today, speaking with members of the Muncie-Delaware County Chamber of Commerce about efforts to grow jobs, support small businesses and keep our communities thriving.

The federal government has no business dictating bathroom policies in our local schools. These decisions should be made by states, local educators and families, not federal bureaucrats on a partisan crusade.   I’m relieved to see POTUS reversing yet another glaring Obama overreach and putting our kids ahead of political ideology.  Read my statement here http://bit.ly/2lvJvhm.
Local manufacturer, Progress Rail, is doing impressive work and employing Hoosiers in the Muncie community. Thanks for the tour!
Ran into some Hoosier heroes in the halls of the Capitol today. Thank you for your service!
Tonight, President Trump laid out a bold agenda for America. It is great to see our nation dreaming big dreams again.
My daughter Emma joined me for the President's Joint Address to Congress. Another special and historic night. President Trump shared an exciting vision our country's future. #JointAddress
Behind the scenes at the #JointAddress last night.   Mr. Speaker, the President of the United States!

I joined C-SPAN after President Donald J. Trump's Joint Address to Congress to offer my reaction to the speech and discuss what hit home for Hoosiers:  Back home in Indiana, folks are focused on jobs. When the President talked about stagnant wages, frozen paychecks, the fact that many hardworking people in America feel like they're on a treadmill and can't get ahead... these issues are important to Hoosiers. Hoosiers also care deeply about national security. People want to feel safe when when they go a movie, or their kids go to school, or they go to a mall.  Hear more from the interview and share your thoughts on the issues that matter most to you.
Indiana local government officials visited the Capitol yesterday. We spoke about ways to keep our Hoosier communities thriving. Great work being done by the Association of Indiana Counties (AIC).

Thousands of veterans across the country and in Indiana were attending ITT Technical Institute when it shut down this fall.  Many of these vets struggled to transfer their credits and get enrolled in a new school. Now, they face running out of their GI Bill benefits before they can earn a degree.  Jason from Indiana, a U.S. Navy vet who served multiple tours in the Middle East, shares his story:  “After two years at ITT Tech, I am starting my degree completely from scratch at Ivy Tech. None of my credits transferred. My GI Bill benefits will run out before I can finish my new degree, and I don’t know how I will pay for it out of pocket.  To spend two years of my life at a place with nothing to show for it is one of the biggest disappointments."  I'm working on legislation to assist these vets and restore their GI Bill benefits. These vets deserve our support and a path forward to complete their education.  The American Legion Online Update Student Veterans of America GI Bill of Rights

Congratulations to 6th District sectional champs - the Connersville Spartans, Greensburg Pirates, Northeastern Knights, South Ripley Raiders and the Hauser Jets.  Great story in the IndyStar today recognizing Connersville. I still remember attending the Connersville State Championship rally with my relatives when I was an 8th grader. Basketball continues to bring Hoosier communities together!

Congratulations to our 4th grade boys basketball team on a great season!  As a 5'11" power forward in high school, I sure didn't receive any basketball awards. But these outstanding kids carried their coach to 3rd place out of 24 teams and the coach of the year award.  Proud of them and lots of fun!
Fun time today meeting students, teachers and administrators at Thomas A. Hendricks Elementary in Shelbyville. Keep up the great work!
Speaking to young Hoosiers and encouraging them to dream big is one of the best parts of my job. Thanks Thomas A. Hendricks Elementary for having me.

House Republicans introduced a plan to repeal & replace Obamacare. Visit www.ReadTheBill.GOP to learn more. As we work through this process, I would like to hear how Obamacare has impacted you and your family. Share your story here: http://bit.ly/2mgEbwL

We've been promising for years that we would repeal Obamacare and replace it with something better. We now have the chance to do that. The time for excuses has passed. We've got to come together and get it done.

I joined Squawk Box this morning to provide an update on health care. Below is a clip of the interview.  For years, we've promised that we would repeal Obamacare and replace it with something better. I'm confident we will get this done for the American people.

Several veterans groups stopped by the Capitol this week. It is always an honor to meet these American heroes, get their feedback and hear ideas about how we can better serve those who dedicated their lives to serving all of us.
Hudson, Emma & I are ready to root on Greensburg-native Bryant McIntosh at the Big Ten Tourney. Go Wildcats!
Productive meeting today with Rushville Mayor Pavey and members of the Rush County Economic Development Corporation. Working together to help encourage job growth in our region.
Met this morning with leaders of the Greensburg and Decatur County communities.
Great to be at the White House last week w/ President Donald J. Trump, Vice President Mike Pence and Whip Congressman Steve Scalise. Exciting work to get done for the American people.

As Congress works to repeal and replace Obamacare, I asked YOU to share your stories. I've heard from many Hoosiers, like a doctor from our 6th District who shared this:  "I am a family physician, and I have found that as a result of Obamacare, my patients have more limited options, longer wait times for approval of vital procedures and medications, and - through the confusing nature of the health insurance marketplace - have ended up with plans they didn't understand and couldn't afford."  Share you story by taking my Obamacare survey here http://bit.ly/2mpzWOX, and learn about plans to repeal and replace Obamacare at www.ReadTheBill.GOP.

Congratulations to Senator Dan Coats for his confirmation as the Director of National Intelligence. President Donald J. Trump could not have picked a better person for the job. Dan Coats is an extraordinary Hoosier, a man of integrity with sound judgment, a level head and an expert in the field.
Students from Rising Sun High School are visiting DC this week. It was a cold day at the Capitol, but great to talk with a group of bright, young Hoosiers!

Obamacare failed Hoosiers. Health care costs sky rocketed, plans got worse and people have less coverage and less choice today than ever before. We are going to repeal and replace this disastrous law.

More of you have shared your Obamacare stories. A Shelbyville resident shares this:  “My husband lost hours at his job at school because of Obamacare’s full-time worker mandates. My work insurance has increased in cost with less coverage. We work hard for our benefits, and now the benefits are terrible. Now, I pay MORE for worse coverage, and we lost income. Double whammy.”  A Muncie resident shares this:  “My premium went from $492 per month in 2009 to $2,200 per month in 2014. Needless to say, I couldn't maintain the payments.”
Hope you all had a great trip to the Capitol!
Working to restore GI bill benefits to vets impacted by ITT Tech and other school closures. We have a moral obligation to do right by these veterans.
What a great run by Northwestern and Greensburg-native Bryant McIntosh. Congratulations on a fantastic season!
President Trump greets House Republicans right now. Leading the fight for Obamacare repeal and replace.

This morning, I shared your Obamacare stories on the House Floor. I've heard from countless Hoosiers in the 6th District whose health care costs have skyrocketed, who lost their plan or their doctor, and who have worse coverage today than before Obamacare.   We can do better for Hoosiers, and we will.

As the Senate hearings for Judge Neil Gorsuch continue, I hope he will be confirmed quickly. Our Supreme Court has been one seat short for too long, and, with the election over, the excuses for delay have simply run out.
I have heard from countless Hoosiers in the 6th District of Indiana who are hurting under Obamacare, and who have sent me here to repeal this disastrous law.
I joined CNBC this morning to talk about the plan to repeal Obamacare and replace it with something far better. I am optimistic we will come together and get this done for the American people.

What an honor to meet Vann Smith, a young advocate working to improve educational opportunities for people with Down Syndrome. He plans to continue his education at Erskine Green Training Institute in Indiana. An impressive young man!
Great news for the Hoosier economy!

This is a bad day for the American people. Today’s defeat means health care costs will continue to rise, coverage will get worse and millions of families will continue to be shackled to Obamacare’s suffocating mandates and taxes. That said, our work continues. I will always fight for the Hoosiers who sent me here and strive to repeal this failed law.
Students from Shelbyville Middle School visited the Capitol this week. Great to see them enjoying their trip, and getting an up-close look at our nation's history and government.

As the husband of a working professional and father of two young girls, I am concerned about the challenges women face in the workforce and eager to discuss innovative, private sector solutions that are helping women break down barriers to success.  Thanks Rep. Martha McSally for leading a great hearing on such an important topic. #GOPWorking4Women
Thanks for your vote Vice President Mike Pence to stand up for states' rights and protect life.
Today I made stops in Shelbyville and Muncie to talk with Hoosiers in the 6th District about issues important to them. Thank you to everyone who came out and shared their thoughts.
The Senate recently passed legislation I worked on to ensure states, like Indiana, are not forced to direct public tax dollars to the abortion industry.

High school students in the 6th District are invited to participate in the 2017 Congressional Art Competition.   The winning entry of the 6th District's competition will be displayed for one year in the U.S. Capitol, alongside other contest winners nationwide.  I encourage everyone to participate and can’t wait to see the winning piece showcased in our nation’s capital.

Congress is leaving for Easter break with work undone. I spoke on the House floor today calling on Congress to come back next week, instead of breaking for Easter, to repeal and replace Obamacare.   We need to do what we said we would do.

A recent Gallup poll found that 64 percent of Americans are worried about not having enough money for retirement. We all struggle to know how far our savings will stretch.  During National Retirement Planning Week, I introduced bipartisan legislation to help working Americans better plan and save for retirement.
Here is my statement on last night's U.S. military strike in Syria:

I am glad to see Judge Neil Gorsuch confirmed to #SCOTUS. Judge Gorsuch is an exceptional, well-respected jurist who is committed to upholding our Constitution and defending the individual liberties of every American.

Honored to receive the National Association of Manufacturers (NAM) Award for supporting manufacturing in the U.S. The 6th District is home to many great manufacturers, like Honda in Greensburg, that are fueling our local economy and providing good-paying jobs to Hoosiers.

For generations, the American dream has meant that every American who works hard can find success. But in recent years, frozen paychecks, a tough job market and rising living costs make the American Dream too often seem out of reach.  As Chair of the Republican Policy Committee, I launched the Task Force for the American worker to address these challenges and find solutions to improve the lives of everyday working people.

Great article by IU President Michael McRobbie on tackling student debt. I've authored legislation modeled after one of IU's successful programs, which has helped reduce student borrowing. 45 percent of IU's bachelor's degree recipients now graduate debt-free.   Continuing to look for ways to help our students succeed!

President Donald J. Trump just signed legislation into law that overturns an Obama regulation forcing states to distribute public tax dollars to abortion providers. Today is a victory for pro-life policy.
‪Happy Vaisakhi/National Sikh Day/Creation of Khalsa Day to Hoosier Sikhs and the 30 million Sikhs across the world. ‬
He is risen! Happy Easter!

In 18 states and the District of Columbia, voters don't have to show any ID when voting.  I've authored legislation to help ensure integrity in federal elections by requiring voters to show a photo ID, like we do in Indiana. The legislation would also make sure those who genuinely can't afford a photo ID can obtain one without charge.

The steel industry has been a critical part of the Indiana economy for decades, supplying thousands of good-paying jobs and livelihoods to Hoosiers.  If we don’t take serious steps to protect American-made steel and steelworkers from unfair trade practices, the Hoosier economy will feel the pain.   I thank President Trump for standing up for Indiana steel and am eager to work with him to further this effort in Congress.
Today I joined CNBC Squawk Box to talk about our recently launched Task Force for the American Worker and how we can combat stagnant wages.

For generations, we’ve called it the American Dream, but it’s really the American promise… Hard work will be rewarded. Unfortunately, for many Americans, that promise no longer rings true.  For too many, hard work doesn’t seem to be paying off… wages are stagnant and paychecks have flat-lined. We need a renewed focus on addressing these challenges and improving opportunity for everyday working people.

Today I joined President Donald J. Trump as he signed an Executive Order targeting federal education overreach.  Our schools, teachers and administrators are buried under one-size-fits-all, federal regulations that in many cases do more harm than good. We need to identify outdated and overreaching rules that restrict local educators, stifle innovation in the classroom and ultimately hold our students back from success.   I commend President Trump and Secretary DeVos for working to bring our education system into the 21st Century, and give more control to parents and local educators.
It's Take Your Kids to Work Day. I've got Ava and Hudson with me, and we're off to Committee!

Cutting taxes for job creators and working families is critical to jump start our economy, grow jobs and increase paychecks. President Trump’s tax plan is a step in the right direction. It will encourage employers, small businesses and entrepreneurs to invest, take chances and hire. Most importantly, it will cut and simplify taxes for Hoosiers.
Great to have Ava and Hudson with me for Take Your Kids to Work Day. We were busy today meeting with constituents and attending Committee hearings... Never a dull moment!
NA
I was honored to spend time with The Lugar Series class of 2016-2017 today. Expect great things from this talented group of Hoosier leaders!
8th grade students from Burris Laboratory School in Muncie, IN visited the Capitol yesterday. Great to see these young Hoosiers during their trip to DC!

Today is an exciting day for those of us who have been working and fighting to end Obamacare’s reign over this country. Today the House will vote to move legislation forward that will repeal Obamacare and replace it with something far better.

Very proud of Jennifer Messer's leadership as President of the Congressional Club. Today's luncheon with First Lady Melania Trump broke all fundraising records for this historic charitable organization.

After years of promises to Hoosiers, we are moving forward to repeal Obamacare and replace it with something far better. This is a step away from more government control of our healthcare and our day-to-day lives, and a return to freedom for all Americans.
Great to be with the folks at VIP Tools in Shelbyville this morning!

Helped kick off a Google online safety program at Northside Middle School in Columbus today. I'm glad to see a leading tech company engage with students and get them excited about careers in technology, while at the same time helping them stay protected online.

While it is fair to ask questions about the sudden firing of FBI Director James Comey, it would be unfair to ignore the broad consensus criticizing Comey’s poor performance in his job. In today’s world, we all need to hit the pause button and make sure we get the facts before jumping to any conclusions.

Students from all across the 6th District gathered in Columbus for the 2017 Congressional Leadership Academy. It was great to meet these young Hoosier leaders. I'm sure we'll see much more from these talented folks as they continue to make their mark!  Special thanks to our fantastic speakers - Columbus Mayor Jim Lienhoop, Indiana National Guard Commander General Corey Carr, President of ClusterTruck Chris Baggott, and Director of International Government Relations at Cummins Inc. Shannon Kiely-Heider.
NA

For three election cycles, Hoosiers have sent Republicans to the House, Senate and the White House – all on the promise to repeal Obamacare. And for good reason. Though Obamacare helped some, it left a vast majority of folks in our state worse off.   I remain confident we will get the American Health Care Act across the finish line, improve health care in our state and country, and make good on our promise to Hoosiers.
NA
Happy Mother's Day everyone!  Thank you to the Mother's in our life.  And, thank you to all the Hoosier Mothers who strengthen and support families across our state!

I'm excited to announce that Jaylei Osting, an 11th grade student at Winchester Community High School, is the winner of this year's 6th District Congressional Art Competition. Jaylei’s piece "Ribbon Symphony" will hang in the U.S. Capitol for one year, where visitors from all over the world will be able to see and enjoy it. Thanks to all of the students who participated.
Speaking with some of Indiana's best and brightest! Great to be with the Indiana Leadership Forum today during their trip to the Capitol.

The House has been working on several bills this week to support law enforcement officers, honor their sacrifices, and give local police additional tools to keep our communities safe. You can read about these bills and others being considered this week here https://policy.house.gov/legislative/legislative-digest/week-may-15th #NationalPoliceWeek
Great to talk with Indiana Department of Education Superintendent Dr. Jennifer McCormick today about improving education for Hoosier kids.

The House passed several bills this week to support law enforcement officers during #NationalPoliceWeek.  Our law enforcement officers and first responders are on the front lines, protecting our communities and keeping us safe each day. We owe them a great debt, and should stand up for them the way they stand up for all of us. These bills will help honor the service and sacrifice of our police men and women, and ensure those who harm our officers are brought to justice.
Shenandoah School Corporation middle school students are at the Capitol for their annual trip to DC. Always great to see this group from Middletown, Indiana.

Indiana has proven time and again that the best government is closest to the people it serves. Our states, cities and counties are the true engine for innovation in our government.   I'm excited to serve on the Task Force on Intergovernmental Affairs to combat federal overreach and return power to states.

Our nation's thoughts and prayers are with the victims of last night’s senseless attack, along with their families, friends and the people of Manchester. Targeting children and teens is yet another unconscionable and cowardly act of terror. May this steel our resolve to stand strong against radical Islamic terrorism.

GOOD NEWS --> President Donald J. Trump's budget request includes my proposal to close a loophole that allows billions of dollars in Child Tax Credits to be claimed by illegal immigrants.   Hoosiers are tired of our broken tax and immigration systems that reward people who come here illegally. Federal tax benefits should go to low and middle-income American families who work hard and play by the rules, not to those who break them.
More Hoosiers are at the Capitol today! Thanks for stopping by St Bartholomew School.

I spoke on House Floor today in support of legislation to protect young athletes from sexual abuse.   Over the course of the past couple of years, countless stories of young athletes being abused - including in Indiana - have revealed glaring inadequacies in our law. These stories, many about coaches, doctors, trainers, and other adults who have abused their positions of authority and trust to exploit young athletes, are appalling. Every one of these kids deserves better.  That's why the House passed legislation today to strengthen reporting requirements for suspected child abuse in athletic organizations. Read more here http://bit.ly/2rmfIM8.

As we head into the holiday weekend to enjoy time with family and friends, let's all remember the reason we get to celebrate. It’s all thanks to the men and women who have put their lives on the line so that we can be free.  We are proud of our military men and women in Indiana. Thank you for your service!
Gentleman...(and ladies!) start your engines! The Messer family just arrived at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. it's going to be a great day!

Great day at the Indianapolis 500 yesterday with family and friends. Now we remember the reason we get to celebrate... thank you to our military members, veterans and especially our fallen service members. I'm proud to join the Greensburg American Legion this morning to honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice for our freedom.
Jennifer and I were honored to join the Greensburg American Legion for their Memorial Day Remembrance Ceremony this morning. It was a wonderful way to pay tribute to our veterans.

I’m looking forward to exploring new ways to empower states and limit federal overreach alongside colleagues from both sides of the aisle. By teaming up with state and local governments, this bipartisan task force will identify ways to reduce some of the federal government’s unnecessary burdens it places on our communities.  http://www.indianachamberblogs.com/rep-messer-appointed-to-task-force-on-reigning-in-federal-government-empowering-states/

Encouraged to see more Hoosiers voice support for an effort I’m working on to ensure tax credits aren’t rewarding illegal immigration. Federal tax benefits should go to low and middle-income American families who work hard and play by the rules, not to those who break them.  http://www.therepublic.com/2017/05/31/letter_support_congressmans_proposal_in_budget/
I got the chance to tour Batesville Airport today. This impressive local company is helping drive economic development in our community and connect Southeast Indiana to the world! #IN06

73 years ago today, Allied troops stormed the beaches in Normandy, France. Meeting Hoosier veterans, like D-Day survivor Bush White of Rising Sun, is something I will always cherish. We will never forget the sacrifice and bravery of America's greatest generation. #dday

Wishing a Happy Birthday to my good friend and predecessor in the 6th Congressional District, Vice President Mike Pence! We are so proud of the work you're doing in the White House on behalf of Hoosiers and all Americans!
Happy to welcome our Indiana State Senator Doug Eckerty to the Capitol! Indiana Senate GOP

On the 50th anniversary of the reunification of Jerusalem, we reaffirm our strong commitment to Israel. May the Jewish State remain a beacon of light, representing democracy and freedom. And may peace and prosperity reign for its people.

Our border patrol is critically understaffed, putting our national security at risk and contributing to illegal immigration. The House passed a common-sense fix to help steer us back to rule of law, secure our border and finally address illegal immigration in this country. https://messer.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-messer-votes-to-streamline-hiring-of-us-border-patrol-agents

“Dodd-Frank has been great for federal regulators and big banks, but it has been very bad for Hoosier consumers. The Financial Choice Act changes that by ending ‘too-big-to-fail’ and enabling Hoosier financial institutions to escape the one-size-fits-all regulatory regime of Dodd-Frank.” Learn more: http://bit.ly/2sk9w7n

It's important that we continue to recognize the significant impact farming has on the American economy. Simply put, agriculture is a really big deal in Indiana and the Hoosier farmer does all the heavy lifting.

GREAT NEWS: The House voted to reform the VA so that our veterans can get the care they need and deserve. Our military men and women – our Hoosier heroes – fought to protect us. The least we can do is fight for them to ensure they get quality care. Learn more: http://bit.ly/2sluuT8
Please join me in sending thoughts and prayers to my friend Congressman Steve Scalise, staff of Roger Williams, Capitol police and all other victims and their families.

It was an honor to talk with WORLD Magazine about faith, family and public service today. Refreshing and humbling conversation after a tough few days. In Case You Missed It: Below are the key elements of the President's military and diplomatic strategy in Afghanistan/South Asia, provided directly by the White House. More specifics can be found here: http://bit.ly/2wAMZF2   • First, any future decision to withdraw U.S. forces from Afghanistan will depend on conditions on the ground, not arbitrary timetables. The President wants America’s enemies to know they can never wait us out or doubt our resolve.  • Second, the new strategy will integrate all instruments of American power—diplomatic, economic, and military—in a way that is sustainable and cost-effective. We will bolster the fighting strength of government forces by providing advisors to Afghan brigades and additional combat air support in order to convince the Taliban they cannot win on the battlefield. This will set conditions for the ultimate goal of our strategy: a peace settlement between the government of Afghanistan and the Taliban that protects our interests.  • Third, our approach with Pakistan will change: it will reflect the commonsense understanding that no partnership can survive a country’s tolerance for militants and terrorists who target US service members and officials. Any country that takes this course will be held accountable.  • New strategy will also emphasize developing our strategic partnership with India—the world’s largest democracy and a key security and economic partner. We will work with India to further our common interest and defending our common values.

When ITT Technical Institute closed its doors last fall, thousands of veterans were left without a degree or path forward. Our bipartisan legislation to restore GI Bill benefits for these veterans takes effect tomorrow. Thank you to everyone who attended and participated in today's roundtable. http://bit.ly/2hqdCny
Good News --> Legislation to restore GI Bill benefits for veterans attending ITT Tech takes effect today.  Apply here: https://benefits.va.gov/GIBILL/docs/EntitlmentRestoration.pdf
President Donald J. Trump making final push for tax cuts to the Republican Conference. Time to give the American worker a pay raise!

Today is a huge victory for working Americans. The tax cut plan the House passed will deliver more jobs, fairer taxes and a bigger paychecks for Hoosier families. Now, the U.S. Senate needs to act, prove to the American people it can get something done, and keep its promise to Hoosiers. Thanks to President Donald J. Trump for his leadership on this today!
In Case You Missed It: I joined Fox News yesterday after the House passed a tax cut plan to give working Hoosiers a pay raise. Now, the U.S. Senate needs to act.
I agree with President Donald J. Trump. North Korea continues to pose a serious threat to the rest of the world. Kim Jong-un's rogue regime belongs on the state sponsors of terror list.

I am pro-life because all human life has dignity and must be protected, especially the lives of defenseless unborn children. Thankful for the opportunity to serve Hoosiers and fight for the right to life each and every day.
Opening night for Indiana high school basketball. Greensburg Pirates vs. North Decatur Chargers. Fun to be at this one!

GOOD NEWS - The Education Department has restored Pell Grant eligibility to students who were attending ITT Tech when it closed last fall. I appreciate the Trump Administration for doing right by these students and ensuring they have a path forward to continue their education.
From our family to yours, Happy Thanksgiving! As we spend time with family and friends, I hope we all can adopt a ‘gratitude attitude.' We are a blessed nation!
It’s not OK that taxpayer money is used to silence victims of sexual harassment. If these victims want to tell their story, they should be empowered to do so.
Taxpayer dollars should never be used to protect members of Congress and silence victims of sexual assault. I joined Dana Perino on Fox News today to discuss my legislation that would stop this.
Today, the House voted to make sexual harassment training mandatory for all members and their staff. This is an important first step but it's clear more must be done.
Good news -- Legislation I cosponsored to ensure the rights of law abiding gun owners aren't restricted across state lines is headed to the House floor.

I strongly support moving the U.S. Embassy in Israel to Jerusalem and encourage President Donald J. Trump to begin the relocation process. Israel is our closest ally and the Holy City should be rightfully recognized as its capital.
Members of Congress should not treat taxpayer dollars like a slush fund to settle sexual harassment charges, and my legislation would put a stop to it.

The last time we had major tax reform, I was playing middle linebacker for the Greensburg Pirates. Joined Harris Faulkner on Fox News today to discuss the opportunity we have to deliver a pay raise to working Hoosiers.
We can't continue to reward those who come to our country illegally. The Senate needs to include our legislation to end tax credits for illegal immigrants in the final tax bill.
Hoosiers agree that Israel is our most important ally in the region, and President Donald J. Trump's decision reaffirms our commitment to stand with the Jewish State.

Good News --> Legislation I co-sponsored to ensure the rights of law-abiding gun owners aren't restricted across state lines passed the House today. Now, we need to push the Senate to pass the same bill!

"December 7, 1941. A date which will live in infamy."  On this #PearlHarbor Remembrance Day, I'm thankful for those in the greatest generation who defended our nation during World War II, including my Grandfather Jack Rotzien.
Stopping sexual harassment isn’t a Republican or Democrat issue. It’s simply the right thing to do. Read more about our efforts to protect victims and stop taxpayer-funded settlements in my op-ed:
The final tax cut plan should include our provision to stop tax credits for illegal immigrants. Working to ensure these credits go to law-abiding, American families.
On this day 201 years ago, Indiana became the 19th state to join the Union. Happy #StatehoodDay, Hoosiers!
To all those who celebrate the Festival of Lights, have a blessed and happy Hanukkah!

The Obamacare individual mandate is a tax on low and middle income Hoosiers, plain and simple. It's outrageous that the federal government continues to penalize folks who can't afford Obamacare's skyrocketing health insurance premiums. We should immediately repeal this burdensome Obamacare mandate and deliver much-needed relief to middle-class Hoosiers.

Good News -- our bipartisan legislation to help more community college transfer students earn degrees was included in the broader higher education package that passed committee this week.  By making it easier for transfer students to combine credits and get a degree they’ve earned, Hoosiers will have more opportunities to get good-paying jobs and succeed in today's workforce.
With tax cuts, we are closer than ever to delivering on one of President Donald J. Trump's key agenda items, and it's great for working Hoosiers.
We're closer than ever to delivering on one of President Trump's biggest campaign promises - tax cuts for America's workers. It's time to give Hoosiers a pay raise!

For Hoosier families, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act:  ✅ Doubles the Child Tax Credit from $1,000 to $2,000 per child. ✅ Protects nearly double the amount of what you earn each year from taxes by increasing the standard deduction. ✅ Eliminates Obamacare’s individual mandate penalty tax.

One of President Donald J. Trump's key campaign promises was to cut taxes for working Americans and today we delivered. Under this plan, Hoosier families will see bigger paychecks, fairer taxes, and more jobs.

With the passage of President Donald J. Trump's tax plan, working Hoosiers will see more jobs, bigger paychecks, and a fairer, simpler tax code. The proof is in the paycheck, and the truth is an average Indiana family will see a tax cut between one thousand and two thousand dollars with this plan.
The president's tax cut plan will grow our economy and give working Hoosiers a pay raise. I was proud to vote in support, and we're starting to see results!

In a last ditch effort to obstruct the President's tax cut plan, Senate Democrats targeted a provision that would have helped two million homeschooled students across America. All this tactic did was delay final passage of the bill by one day, but it will hurt homeschooled children long-term.   This is unacceptable. Our legislation will make sure homeschool families have the same opportunities and resources that every other student has.

The Senate should not shield its members from the consequences of their own actions. It was never OK that taxpayer dollars were used to settle harassment claims against members of Congress, and we need to get to the bottom of it.   The Senate should immediately release this information to taxpayers, empower the victims and make sure it does not happen again.
Hope you are enjoying the Christmas season with family and friends. From the Messer family to yours, Merry Christmas!
President Donald J. Trump's tax cut plan means more jobs, bigger paychecks, and a fairer, simpler tax code for working Hoosiers.
Thanks to the Indiana Chamber of Commerce for its support of our bill to help transfer students earn degrees and succeed in today's workforce.
